Package com.dermalog.android.embeddedbiometrics

The class EmbeddedBiometricsSDK provides access to the native library DermalogEmbeddedBiometrics.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DEBLed
    Interface containing scanner LEDs values
    DEBLedColor
    Interface containing color values for LEDs
    DEBProperty
    Properties of the EmbeddedBiometricsHandle
    DEBTemplateFormat
    Class containing values for finger print tempalte formats
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DEBCaptureInfo
    Info structure for the capture process
    DEBDeviceEntry
    Class representing a device when querying for attached devices
    DEBImageSize
    Class to get tha image size and buffer size of captured images.
    EmbeddedBiometricsException
    Represents errors that occur inside EmbeddedBiometricsSDK.
    EmbeddedBiometricsHandle
    The EmbeddedBiometricsHandle holds an device instance for the EmbeddedBiometricsSDK.
    EmbeddedBiometricsSDK
    Wrapper for the native library DermalogEmbeddedBiometrics.

Package com.dermalog.android.embeddedbiometrics Description

The class EmbeddedBiometricsSDK provides access to the native library DermalogEmbeddedBiometrics.

In order to use the SDK, you need to add the following entries to your AndroidManifest.xml 


        <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
        <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.USB_PERMISSION" />
        <uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.usb.host" />

Important: The call of queryDevices() requires granted Android USB permissions for the attached DERMALOG fingerprint scanner. See requestUSBPermissions(com.dermalog.android.usb.IUSBPermission).
The following pseudo code shows how to capture and verify fingerprints: 

 
EmbeddedBiometricsSDK sdk = null;
EmbeddedBiometricsHandle handle = null;

try{
        sdk = new EmbeddedBiometricsSDK(activity);
        
        sdk.requestUSBPermissions(...)  
        //wait for usb permissions callback or continue in asynchronous context         
                
        sdk.initialize();

        //search for devices
        DEBDeviceEntry devices[] = sdk.queryDevices();
                
        handle = sdk.open(devices[0]);
        
        //allocate memory for 2 images
        DEBImageSize imgSize = handle.scannerGetImageSize();    
        ByteBuffer buffer = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(imgSize.getSizeBIH());
        
        //auto capture first fingerprint without timeout
        DEBCaptureInfo capInfo = new DEBCaptureInfo();
        handle.scannerAutoCapture(0, buffer.array(), capInfo);
        
        //get NIST quality (1 to 5)
        int nfiq = handle.imageNISTQuality(buffer.array());
        
        //create first fingerint template
        byte[] template1 handle.templateExtract(buffer.array(), DEBTemplateFormat.DERMALOG);
        
        //auto capture second fingerprint with 5 seconds timeout
        handle.scannerAutoCapture(5000, buffer.array(), capInfo);
        
        //Verify only if second fingerprint has been captured
        if( capInfo.isDetect() )
        {       
                //create second fingerint template
                byte[] template2 handle.templateExtract(buffer.array(), DEBTemplateFormat.DERMALOG);
                
                //Verify (1:1 match)
                double score = templateVerify(DEBTemplateFormat.DERMALOG, template1, DEBTemplateFormat.DERMALOG, template2);
        }               
}finally{
        if(handle != null)
        {
                handle.dispose();
                handle = null;
        }
        
        if(sdk != null)
        {
                sdk.uninitialize();
                sdk = null;
        }
}
